recipes.title: Albertosaurus
recipes.description: Albertosaurus was a tyrannosaur, a family of large theropods from the Late Cretaceous Period

recipes.title: Allosaurus
recipes.description: Allosaurus was a giant theropod, one of the largest before the appearance of the tyrannosaurs about 70 million years later

recipes.title: Apatosaurus
recipes.description: Apatosaurus was a huge sauropod that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic period

recipes.title: Archaeopteryx
recipes.description: Archaeopteryx is the earliest and most primitive bird known. It has features that resemble both birds and dinosaurs

recipes.title: Baryonyx
recipes.description: Baryonyx was a large Early Cretaceous theropod. Its skull was long and narrow like a crocodile’s

recipes.title: Brachiosaurus
recipes.description: Brachiosaurus was a huge sauropod that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic Period. Like all sauropods

recipes.title: Carnotaurus
recipes.description: Carnotaurus was a large theropod that lived in South America during the Late Cretaceous Period. It is known from a single fossil

recipes.title: Coelophysis
recipes.description: Coelophysis was a theropod from Triassic North America. It had a narrow head, shaped like a stork’s

recipes.title: Compsognathus
recipes.description: Compognathus was a small, bird-like theropod, about the size of a turkey, but with a slender body

recipes.title: Deinonychus
